lines.text: Oh, oh, that's not for ladies.
Pardon me, miss. This is a saloon.
Well, I've lived for sixty years and that's the first time I ever saw a woman goin' into a saloon.
Next thing you know they will be smoking cigarettes.
Oh, talk sense, man, talk sense.
Toby Walker, you're supposed to be a sharpshooter and you can't even see a woman gal under your own nose.
I can see anything I'm aiming at.
Perfume. Dang it, you smell like Happy Minnie's back in Omaha.
Ah, I was wondering, Mr. MacIvor, if you could help me find some plain sewing.
Well, I don't know about needlework, but, uh, I've got a cigar stand at the hotel.
Oh, I love a man who smokes a cigar!
Mind yuh, the job only calls for sellin' cigars.
